intro: Scleria auricoma, commonly known as the auriculate scleria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it typically grows in wetland or marshy environments. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, three-petaled white or pale blue flowers. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Scleria auricoma plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland ecosystems and supports local biodiversity.
